medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in his usual state of health until 6 months before admission, when shortness of breath developed. His exercise capacity gradually decreased from walking three blocks to climbing one flight of stairs. Three days before admission, dyspnea increased, leading to difficulty walking two to three steps on a level plane. Additionally, there were changes in demeanor such as somnolence, decreased appetite, urine output, and unsteady gait.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes mellitus, coronary artery disease (treated with a stent 10 years earlier), complete heart block, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, cerebrovascular disease, osteoarthritis, hearing impairment, vertigo, and cataracts. Previous transurethral prostatectomy; diagnosed with complete heart block 6 years earlier.
medical_history.family_history: Father had died of colon cancer; a brother had heart disease and asbestosis; mother died at 49 of unknown causes; adult children are well.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived alone, did his own shopping and cooking, was a retired plumber exposed to asbestos while working in a shipyard, smoked three packs of cigarettes per day for 50 years (stopped 14 years earlier), and drank alcohol occasionally; did not use illicit drugs.
